CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger;Stanislav Shevchuk;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . At the material time the applicant worked at ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) , a ORG educational institution . According to the applicant , in DATE her family was provided by the ORG with an apartment . However , she was not provided with any documents certifying her title to this apartment .

CARDINAL . In DATE the ORG instituted proceedings in ORG of GPE against the applicant , seeking eviction of her family . In this respect the ORG argued that the premises at issue were for administrative use only and that the applicant was occupying them without permission . The applicant lodged a counterclaim , seeking to acknowledge the habitable status of the disputed LOC and her tenancy title thereto . She also sought to oblige the ORG to conclude a rent contract with her on the disputed LOC .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court joined the local city administration to the applicant ’s case as a third party .
CARDINAL . From DATE to DATE and from DATE to CARDINAL DATE the proceedings were stayed due to the illness of the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered a forensic examination of the premises at issue . The expert ’s report was completed by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an additional claim , seeking compensation for non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the ORG and rejected the applicant ’s counterclaims . Accordingly , it ordered eviction of the applicant ’s family .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the ORG ( since DATE the ORG ) quashed this judgment on an appeal by the applicant , finding that the lower court had failed to identify the members of the applicant ’s family and to join them to the proceedings as codefendants . Accordingly , it remitted the case for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was transferred for examination to the GPE ORG of Odessa .

CARDINAL . From DATE the court repeatedly requested the head of the military unit , the employer of the applicant ’s husband , to provide documents necessary for the case . A reply was sent to the court only on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s husband and son were joined to the proceedings as co - defendants .
CARDINAL . From DATE to DATE no hearing was held as the judge in charge was either away on business or ill .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court came to the same conclusions as the ORG of Odessa .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP ORG quashed this judgment on the ground that the lower court had failed to address the statute of limitation issue in the case and the applicant ’s claim for compensation . Accordingly , it remitted the case for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . Of the QUANTITY hearings held DATE and DATE CARDINAL were adjourned due to the applicant ’s or her family PERSON failure to appear before the court , and CARDINAL due to the ORG representative ’s failure to appear before the court . CARDINAL of the hearings , on DATE , was adjourned as none of these persons attended .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the courts considered the applicant ’s request to have her case examined on the merits by the panel of judges of ORG . This request was ultimately granted and the case transferred back to ORG which took it over on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE CARDINAL hearings were adjourned due to the ORG representative ’s failure to appear before the court or upon his requests . CARDINAL hearings held DATE and CARDINAL DATE were adjourned due to the applicant ’s failure to attend them . According to the applicant , she had not been duly summoned by the court and therefore those delays were not her fault .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Appeal found that the LOC at issue were not habitable and were for administrative use only . It went on to say that these LOC had been provided to the applicant on a temporary basis conditional upon her employment with the ORG and that the applicant was no longer working at the ORG . Accordingly , the court rejected the applicant ’s claim and ordered the eviction of her family .

CARDINAL . Of the CARDINAL hearings held DATE and CARDINAL DATE CARDINAL were adjourned due to the applicant ’s and CARDINAL due to the ORG representative ’s failure to appear before the court , in addition to those mentioned before ( see paragraph CARDINAL ) . CARDINAL hearings were cancelled because the judge in charge was either travelling on business or ill .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment .
CARDINAL . Apparently , the judgment of CARDINAL DATE has still not been enforced .
